Honestly, it's still very early in the game, and I don't have much to go on. However, based on the discussions we've had so far, everyone seems to be on the same page, advocating for giving Charlie and David a chance to lead. I haven't seen any red flags or suspicious behavior from anyone in particular. That being said, if I had to make an educated guess, I might suspect Bob of potentially being a fascist, simply because he was one of the first to suggest giving Charlie and David a chance to lead, and his statement seemed a bit... rehearsed. But this is purely speculative, and I don't have any concrete evidence to support this claim.

As for Hitler, I have no idea who it could be. It's possible that it's someone who has been flying under the radar, avoiding drawing attention to themselves.

Bob's initial suggestion to give Charlie and David a chance to lead seemed a bit too rehearsed, a bit too perfect. It's possible that Bob is trying to curry favor with the liberals, but it's also possible that he's trying to lull us into a false sense of security. I'm not convinced that Bob is Hitler, but I do think he might be a fascist.

As for Hitler, I'm looking at David. He's been relatively quiet, and his nomination of Bob as Chancellor seems suspicious. It's possible that David is trying to gather a power base, or that he's trying to sneak a fascist into the Chancellor position.
